site.tagline: A brief, public-domain IQ estimate â€” multilingual and free.

disclaimer: This is a short, non-proctored screening using public-domain items (ICAR). Scores are approximate and not a clinical or educational assessment.

home.tests_count_caption: People have used this free, anonymous tool.

card.title: Retake & compare
card.text: You get an ID after the test. Take it again later and compare what changed.

card.title: Public-domain items (ICAR)
card.text: Built on ICAR public-domain items. No account required, multilingual interface.

i1.prompt: What comes next in the number series? 2, 4, 8, 16, ?

about.title: Created by DMZ DATA AS
about.intro: brain-test.org is a free, multilingual IQ screening built in Porsgrunn, Norway. It uses public-domain ICAR items and stores only anonymized results.

contact.title: Contact
contact.p1: Responsible for brain-test.org is DMZ DATA AS. Contact point for privacy inquiries and general questions: post@dmz.no.
contact.p2: Learn more at www.dmz.no.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.p1: We take privacy seriously. This policy explains how brain-test.org handles information. The site is designed to work without collecting personal data; results are stored under a random ID.
privacy.li1: Data we process: We do not collect names, emails, or other directly identifying information. To display and remember results, a system-generated ID is stored together with a summary of answers and derived scores.
privacy.li2: Purpose and legal basis: The purpose is to provide the service and improve its quality. The legal basis is legitimate interest (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)) in operating a secure and functional solution without processing personal data.
privacy.li3: Storage and deletion: Technical IDs and result summaries are stored only as long as necessary for the stated purpose. If you want a result removed, contact us at post@dmz.no with your result ID.
privacy.li4: Sharing and processors: We do not sell or share data with third parties. If we use subcontractors (data processors) for hosting/operations, they are contractually bound to protect data and may not use it for their own purposes.
privacy.li5: International transfers: Our hosting and database providers may process data in the EEA and/or other locations. We use standard safeguards (e.g., SCCs) where relevant.
privacy.li6: Cookies and tracking: We do not use marketing cookies or third-party tracking scripts. If we introduce strictly necessary cookies (e.g., language preference), we will update this policy and request consent where required.
privacy.li7: Security and logs: Technical logs may be processed for troubleshooting and security (e.g., abuse prevention). These logs do not include personal identifiers beyond what is necessary for safe operation.
privacy.li8: Your rights and contact: For questions or deletion of a specific result ID, contact post@dmz.no. You may also lodge a complaint with the Norwegian Data Protection Authority (Datatilsynet). Significant changes to this policy will be published here.
